member.name: T:Vortice.DataStream
member.summary: Provides a stream interface to a buffer located in unmanaged memory.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.#ctor(Vortice.Direct3D.Blob)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a buffer.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and allocates a new buffer to use as a backing store.
member.param: The size of the buffer to be allocated, in bytes.
true if reading from the buffer should be allowed; otherwise, false.
true if writing to the buffer should be allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using an unmanaged buffer as a backing store.
member.param: A pointer to the buffer to be used as a backing store.
The size of the buffer provided, in bytes.
true if reading from the buffer should be allowed; otherwise, false.
true if writing to the buffer should be allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.Create``1(``0[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a managed buffer as a backing store.
member.param: A managed array to be used as a backing store.
true if reading from the buffer should be allowed; otherwise, false.
true if writing to the buffer should be allowed; otherwise, false.
Index inside the buffer in terms of element count (not size in bytes).
True to keep the managed buffer and pin it, false will allocate unmanaged memory and make a copy of it. Default is true.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.Read``1
member.summary: Reads a single value from the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes read.
member.remarks: In order to provide faster read/write, this operation doesn't check stream bound. A client must carefully not read/write above the size of this datastream.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to be read from the stream.
member.exception: This stream does not support reading.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.Read(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.ReadRange``1(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads an array of values from the current stream, and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.remarks: In order to provide faster read/write, this operation doesn't check stream bound. A client must carefully not read/write above the size of this datastream.
member.typeparam: The type of the values to be read from the stream.
member.returns: An array of values that was read from the current stream.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.ReadRange``1(``0[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of elements from the current stream into a target buffer and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.remarks: In order to provide faster read/write, this operation doesn't check stream bound. A client must carefully not read/write above the size of this datastream.
member.param: An array of values to be read from the stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The number of values to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The number of bytes read from the stream.
member.exception: This stream does not support reading.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.Write``1(``0)
member.summary: Writes a single value to the stream, and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.remarks: In order to provide faster read/write, this operation doesn't check stream bound. A client must carefully not read/write above the size of this datastream.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to be written to the stream.
member.param: The value to write to the stream.
member.exception: The stream does not support writing.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.Write(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.WriteRange``1(``0[])
member.summary: Writes an array of values to the current stream, and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.remarks: In order to provide faster read/write, this operation doesn't check stream bound. A client must carefully not read/write above the size of this datastream.
member.param: An array of values to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: This stream does not support writing.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.WriteRange(System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: Writes a range of bytes to the current stream, and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.remarks: In order to provide faster read/write, this operation doesn't check stream bound. A client must carefully not read/write above the size of this datastream.
member.param: A pointer to the location to start copying from.
The number of bytes to copy from source to the current stream.
member.exception: This stream does not support writing.

member.name: M:Vortice.DataStream.WriteRange``1(``0[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes an array of values to the current stream, and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.remarks: In order to provide faster read/write, this operation doesn't check stream bound. A client must carefully not read/write above the size of this datastream.
member.typeparam: The type of the values to be written to the stream.
member.param: An array of values to be written to the stream.
The zero-based offset in data at which to begin copying values to the current stream.
The number of values to be written to the current stream. If this is zero, all of the contents will be written.
member.exception: This stream does not support writing.

member.name: M:Vortice.DXGI.ModeDescription.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,Vortice.DXGI.Format)
member.param: A value that describes the resolution width. If you specify the width as zero when you call the IDXGIFactory.CreateSwapChain method to create a swap chain, the runtime obtains the width from the output window and assigns this width value to the swap-chain description.

A value that describes the resolution height. If you specify the width as zero when you call the IDXGIFactory.CreateSwapChain method to create a swap chain, the runtime obtains the height from the output window and assigns this height value to the swap-chain description.

member.name: M:Vortice.DXGI.ModeDescription.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,Vortice.DXGI.Rational,Vortice.DXGI.Format)
member.param: A value that describes the resolution width. If you specify the width as zero when you call the IDXGIFactory.CreateSwapChain method to create a swap chain, the runtime obtains the width from the output window and assigns this width value to the swap-chain description.

A value that describes the resolution height. If you specify the width as zero when you call the IDXGIFactory.CreateSwapChain method to create a swap chain, the runtime obtains the height from the output window and assigns this height value to the swap-chain description.
A describing the refresh rate in hertz
